website_summaries.verdict: A budget-friendly machine that's more than capable of its job. The best bargain available.
pros: Compact and fast, even when handling multi-page jobs
cons: Fax resolution is a bit low

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to setup and use!
customer_reviews.text: I finally decided to invest in a fax machine, I was tired of paying the high fee's companies want to charge you for sending a few papers. Item came as described, shipped in original box. The fax machine is compact and lightweight. It doesn't take up a lot of space. Setup was very easy, plugged phone cord into my modem and it's ready to go. It's extremely simple to use, sends faxes fast, I placed papers face down, dialed # and pushed send. I love how small and easy it is to use. For the low cost price, it's well worth the money. I am happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mommie2crysti

customer_reviews.title: Extremely satisfied with this little fax machine
customer_reviews.text: Extremely satisfied with this little fax machine. I strongly recommend it! Easy to operate and gets the work done!
customer_reviews.author: AK

customer_reviews.title: Good Small FAX Machine
customer_reviews.text: My old fax 15 years old finally quit. This one seems perfect for the occasional fax. We only use fax a few times a year and this lightweight fax which we keep stored on a book shelf seems perfect for our needs. Have only used it once since our purchase, but it performed as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Sherwood

customer_reviews.title: simple and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our office because their ancient fax machine finally died. They wanted something small, simple and easy to use. This fit the bill. Setup was so easy and everyone in the office loves the ease-of-use. Changing out cartridges is simple. The cartridges print about 150 pages each. For our small office, it is a wonderful fax machine. We're very happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Kristinc

customer_reviews.title: All went well and timely.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good - all working well. Quality and performance 100%. The keys have a quality feel and the printouts look good.
customer_reviews.author: cw

customer_reviews.title: Nice.  affordable. Cheap.
customer_reviews.text: Just perfect for me. Extra: you can fax them to register and they fax you back to let you know it works. Less than just an HP replacement fax ink cartridge. PS. Brother has made great cheap products for decades.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Walker

customer_reviews.title: FAX- 575 .... Think about the operating environment !
customer_reviews.text: This fax is small and compact and fits better in the area because of that. I gave this a rating of three because: 1. I disliked cleaning the head due to residue buildup from the ribbon and disliked the fact that due to the ribbon hanging and sticking to the head, it would smudge the fax and jam frequently . However the environment the machine was placed in was extremely hot ... 100+ degrees, so I suspect this was the source of the excessive failures and cleanings. I replaced this machine with a Brother IntelliFAX 2840 and am happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: With directions that came with the fax, we easily set it up. It worked exactly as a fax should. Much better than my Hp all-in one. It's rarely used so gets uplugged most of the time. No problem occured when plugged back in to use again. No ink is used, its a dry cartridge, so wasteful spending of my hard-earned dollars does not happen like it does with ink cartridges. Bye-bye to HP all-in-one. We recommend this Brother FAX-575 Personal Fax.
customer_reviews.author: ArlineR

customer_reviews.title: Great little fax machine
customer_reviews.text: I don't need to fax very often (usually at tax time and the only number I have on the speed dial list is my accountant) but this machine works well. It fits on my bookcase without taking up all the space on that shelf and it also fits my needs. I can't address the copy part of the machine because I don't use it for that but it does the job as far as faxing goes.
customer_reviews.author: Robert H Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Print ribbon doesn't last long at all.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up. It was a bit smaller than I expected it to be although that was my bad as I simply should have paid better attention to the specs. But it an adequate size for the job. Use it in a home office and we don't do a ton of faxing. My only issue with it is the print ribbon was empty almost immediately. Not too pleased about that. However, I rewound it back to the beginning and got more use out of it. I think I can do that once more before having to buy another one. Other than that it does the job and is easy to both set up and use.
customer_reviews.author: Cleverly Acquired

customer_reviews.title: Not working after 5 months
customer_reviews.text: I use a fax on a very limited basis. This seemed to be a good choice for my needs. 5 months later and it stopped working. I'll now need to deal with warranty and return. Update: I contacted Brother support, the wait to talk to someone was longer than I would have liked. But once connected and having established that the machine was under warranty, Brother agreed to send out a refurbished machine, (not new), to replace my nonfunctional fax. (So no real complaint with customer support.) We'll now see how long this one will last.
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: the machine worked just fine. I was not thrilled with buying a machine ...
customer_reviews.text: the fax machine did not work right away so I called the brother company and the person at brother and I tried to figure out why it was not working. Something was blocking the paper from entering the fax machine and starting the fax. I got a flashlight and found a broken piece of the right side paper adjuster stuck inside the machine. Once I retrieved the broken piece, the machine worked just fine. I was not thrilled with buying a machine that was already broke but since it should not interfere with basic faxing I am not sending it back to the place that I brought it from.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Dvorak

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love this fax machine it does things that I need and it copies very good thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Petty

customer_reviews.title: initial set up was quite easy, but a little confusing as it would ring
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a small office, initial set up was quite easy, but a little confusing as it would ring, and the display states "recieve" and nothing happens, we had a test fax sent and it went through but as it printed the middle of the paper would crinkle and come out a little damaged. not a huge deal but if you have a document with more than a couple pages its very unprofessional. checked the feed and nothing seems to be lodged inside. we decided to return it and spend a little more on a heavier duty model. for 30$ you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Set Shop

customer_reviews.title: Finally, the PERFECT home fax!
customer_reviews.text: Finally, the PERFECT home fax!!! Have had several others, much bigger and more expensive, that didn't work nearly as well as this one. A breeze to set up -- I am mechanically challenged (to put it mildly) -- and I was able to get this thing up and running by myself, without calling for tech support. Plus, it's compact and economical, to boot. Happy, happy, happy.
customer_reviews.author: K. Smith

customer_reviews.title: It works like expected but you have to fight with it at ...
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. It works like expected but you have to fight with it at times and send a fax several times before it finally sends all of the documents. The person I was faxing documents to ended up with 3 partial documents and 1 full set of documents before I finally got all the faxes to go through.
customer_reviews.author: corey350

customer_reviews.title: Works great. No more flaky Internet / web-based faxing where ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great. No more flaky Internet / web-based faxing where you have to give away information or suffer through advertising pages. It has a small footprint and is quiet. Sent and received faxes as described. I keep it in manual mode and only use it for faxes, though the handset is clear and gives a good sound. Definitely recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Good for Personal Faxes...
customer_reviews.text: Works great - rolls of film are short. That's just fine for personal use, but if you are getting daily use out of this I suggest another fax machine. All and all it does exactly what it says and it's for occasional use - not daily use. Faxes are very clear and decent speed in and out. We like it
customer_reviews.author: theMezz

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: An excellent product. Easy set-up, clear crisp copies and I really like that copies are fed "up" into the paper holder rather than sending the copy from the bottom onto the floor. Economical and super performance. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: ezshop

customer_reviews.title: good for the occasional fax
customer_reviews.text: Yes, in 2017, people still use fax machines. I already have scanners and printers, and would have preferred a fax-only device, not being a fan of all-in-one devices. Plugged it in and it went right to work. Definitely a low duty cycle device, but it fits the bill
customer_reviews.author: Martin Fouts

customer_reviews.title: Bought new, got something else.
customer_reviews.text: The product I received was obviously not new but refurbished.. Even the instructions and the amendments to the company's manufacturing address were dated from 2012. Also the listing mentions the print cartridge roll is good for 150 pages but the machine came with a "starter" roll for 30 pages of use. I'll give it the 30 days to see if it still works because I need it now but I am not a Happy Camper on this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: LI Native

customer_reviews.title: IT KEEPS ON TICKIN'!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this bad boy 6 years ago and it is still going strong. It just sits on the corner of my desk collecting dust until that rare occasion when I need it and then it performs beautifully. And so reasonably priced. Now having said that it will probably go up in smoke the next time I want to use it, but you know what? I'll buy another one just like it to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: The Librarian

customer_reviews.title: This is a perfect fax machine for my home office use
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect fax machine for my home office use. I love being able to send multiple pages at a time. It works well with my landline. I had no problem assembling and installing the fax machine. I do not have a dedicated fax line. It shares the line with my phone. I only send out faxes and do not have the need to receive them though I don't believe that would be a problem. The booklet that comes with the machine is organized and helpful.
customer_reviews.author: MAK-NY

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Like it, love the smaller size and it does the job just as good as the big ones.
customer_reviews.author: Mechelle

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: This is an inexpensive fax machine but it is perfect for my home office which doesn't require many faxes. I had to print out the instructions from the internet because it was used and didn't come with any. There was no ink cartridge with it , only one that had been totally used up.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Hart

customer_reviews.title: Dissatisfied customer.
customer_reviews.text: Today this day I can not send or receive a fax. Do I have to find a fax service where I have to pay to send or receive faxes? I don't fax that often. Why pay a service when I only fax once in a blue moon. It ridiculous. I know it's too last to return it since I brought it two years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Singleton

customer_reviews.title: Great fax for small office use.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent fax machine for the money. My old office printer/fax/scanner died after 17 years. I got my money's worth. I wanted a small fax machine for my office. I have a heavy duty Canon ImageCLASS D530 that I also purchased from Amazon. I use that in my home office. For the price this little Brother fax can't be beat. BTW - YouTube videos on this are terrible. Read the instructions for set up and use.
customer_reviews.author: Joan Kaylor, MSEd, LPC

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Have had this for some time now and it performs like a champ. If your papers are too smooth it sometimes runs a couple through at the same time which can be a problem but then I didn't buy a fancy fax machine, so what can you expect?
customer_reviews.author: mandylyn30

customer_reviews.title: A perfect 'light use' home device that is compact, economical and quite user friendly.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for a friend who does not have either a computer smart phone with email capabilities and needed an alternate way to receive documents. It was super easy to set up on the same line with his answering machine and does not conflict with incoming telephone calls - so it did not cause any confusion and was also a snap to show him how to send out faxes and make photo copies which an added bonus for him as he'd been driving to town and paying a local business for copying and faxing service. There have been no problems with paper jams when sending or receiving multiple page documents.
customer_reviews.author: K. M.

customer_reviews.title: Fax machine 575
customer_reviews.text: I RECEIVED IT TODAY AS PROMISED. I have opened it and it is set up for use now. EXCELLENT and a cute beautiful sufficient and efficient fax machine. I love it. And you will too. Recommend. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: chippy

customer_reviews.title: BEST PERSONAL FAX NO INK DRY UP
customer_reviews.text: Love it...perfect just what I expected. Works great. Easy to set up, and I can fax when needed and not worry about ink dry up due to little use. I bought extra Brother pc 501 rolls just incase.
customer_reviews.author: Cindee

customer_reviews.title: Great for light home usage
customer_reviews.text: A very very simple inexpensive fax machine. Great for light home usage. Sends and receives faxes just fine and has a small footprint.
customer_reviews.author: Fotoguy81

customer_reviews.title: Great little fax machine for the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this about 2 years ago now. I do a lot of faxing for my job and I have, for the past couple years, been able to work from home one day a week. For the money, this is a great little fax machine. It does what I need it to do. The ribbon does run out pretty fast but in my case, since I send out way more than receive here at home, it was really not that huge of an issue. If you are looking for a fax machine for occasional use, this is a great buy. Keep in mind that this little fax machine could not keep up with a high volume office.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie K. Walker

customer_reviews.title: Oh brother! What a great machine!
customer_reviews.text: Well mostly I got this because I needed a copier. It worked easily and without incidents. It is easy to assemble and the instructions are good. I have not used the fax part of the machine as yet, I have to get a distinctive ring first. Wow, an hour ago I had no idea what a distinguishing ring referred to, not anymore. The instructions answer all questions, trust me. The instruction manual answered questions that had yet to cross my mind. This was a good price and size for me, because I do not intend to use it much. But it sure makes me fell more secure having my own copier rather than using the library's.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Fax
customer_reviews.text: It's a fax, it works. I had to get this as my employer nixed the use of Sfax by Scrypt, INC, where I could scan and securely fax. Have been using it since June, and it seems to be working well. I don't send or receive many faxes, but it certainly is meeting my needs and does not take up too much of my very limited space. No complaints
customer_reviews.author: tktroma

customer_reviews.title: decent
customer_reviews.text: Simple fax, nothing fancy. Have owned it about a year and have had to use it a few times with no problems. If you just want to have a fax in-home for those times you might need it now and then, this will do the job
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Nice fax for important business transmissions
customer_reviews.text: Very practical Simple to set up and is currently assisting in transmitting faxes daily. Excellent memory feature that stores incoming faxes for future documentation and reprinting.
customer_reviews.author: Woody

customer_reviews.title: Still can't set this up. It's more complicated than ...
customer_reviews.text: Still can't set this up. It's more complicated than an old plug in and go. Will need tech savvy child because this is way beyond my abilities!
customer_reviews.author: nanatotwo

customer_reviews.title: It was a replacement for an older one, so ...
customer_reviews.text: It was a replacement for an older one, so I am quite familiar with the product.I use it instead of "snail mail" when possible, so I know my message has arrived.The USPO has lost too many of my letters.
customer_reviews.author: Don Finck

customer_reviews.title: A Great Find
customer_reviews.text: Trying to find an inexpensive fax machine for my home office was next to impossible. I am technologically challenged and need something simple to set up and simple to use. This Brother was all of the above. It costs a little bit more than I wanted to pay, however, I'm thrilled that otherwise it fits the bill for me.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Forsyth

customer_reviews.title: Really good fax machine
customer_reviews.text: I like this fax machine. It replaces another ancient Brother fax which served me well for many years. This one is smaller and although I have only used it a few times is simple to use. The directions for setting up were not the best, but the Brothers support line was very good. I spoke to a person right away who was very helpful and e mailed me several tips for using the the device. Delivery was very fast. (actually arrived on a Sunday). It will not get heavy use and that is the reason for buying an inexpensive machine.
customer_reviews.author: R.L. Fuller

customer_reviews.title: It is a nice machine, but it doesn't work on my DSL ...
customer_reviews.text: It is a nice machine,but it doesn't work on my DSL (EARTHLINK) ONLY as I have no land line phone connection. That said I like the size and the fact that it has no ink but Thermal Transfer Cartridge,So 1. No ink to dry out when not using frequently. It made a nice copy of a document that I have, but I have good scanne. 2. No aligning print heads each time you change cartridges I had no way of knowing how well it sends and receive faxes( as stated above),but if
customer_reviews.author: R Sam McGee

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Works right out of the box and works well. The quality of the copies is dark, clear, and so good. I should have bought this long ago. It's a cinch to set up, too. One of my best purchases ever. It will save me time going to the copy store to copy documents and send/receive faxes. Way to go, Brother.
customer_reviews.author: Lily

customer_reviews.title: A so-so machine
customer_reviews.text: I bought this fax/copier 6 years ago and have not been happy with the quality of the copies or faxes received. Since I use it only occasionally I didn't get another machine but just put up with the poor quality. However, I just had to replace the cartridge and it was an awful experience. My husband and my handyman also tried to get the cartridge installed, finally we thought we succeeded but now it won't send faxes. I will not buy another Brother product again based on this experience. It's poor quality and cheaply made.
customer_reviews.author: roxalane

customer_reviews.title: works great for the odd fax need to do from home
customer_reviews.text: Simple, cheap, works great for the odd fax need to do from home, if all you need it for is the odd fax or copy now and then 5 stars, a bit complex for receiving though as it shares a line with ooma but no conflicts.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Good buy.
customer_reviews.text: I got rid of my fax machine some time ago when scanners appeared on the scene and seemed to be the better deal for scanning an item and sending as an email attachment. Much to my chagrin, now it seems that companies are going back to requesting faxed documents versus scanned versions. So I ordered this not too expensive model and so far, so good. Have not had any problems with this fax machine. Appears to have a lot of features that I have not even delved into yet.
customer_reviews.author: Truth 101

customer_reviews.title: Great and easy to use product
customer_reviews.text: Great and easy to use product. I'll be honest and say when sending a fax, it is a bit slower than the HP I've previously used for years. But considering that I only send/receive faxes maybe once a month, can't beat the price. Tip, the ink in the box clearly states it is only for maybe 30 pages, so you would probably do well to get the replacement ink at the same (that one rated for 150 pages)
customer_reviews.author: john777p

customer_reviews.title: Cheap 'n' Easy
customer_reviews.text: We only use a fax machine occasionally, but this is just the ticket. Low price, easy to set up and use. Our old fax still worked, but it was almost out of ink. A replacement secondary market cartridge would have cost almost as much as this Brother new machine. The one glitch was that the Brother test phone number doesn't work. But you can Google the H/P number and that will work, no matter what machine you have.
customer_reviews.author: Grandpa D

customer_reviews.title: Used for a printer
customer_reviews.text: My accountant was looking for a printer and this copier was a perfect fit for him. Replacement cartridges are very reasonable. Would recommend for light printing and a great price.
customer_reviews.author: damb

customer_reviews.title: OLD SCHOOL WORKS GREAT FOR THE MONEY
customer_reviews.text: Needed a cheap reliable fax machine to send a few documents from home. This worked great for the money. Not a high output or high tech machine by any means, but it works great for small jobs. Old School thermal transfer paper, so don't expect crystal clear copies on your end.
customer_reviews.author: BWillie

customer_reviews.title: This is a great little home fax
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little home fax. Just turn it on when needed. Unfortunately right after I teceived it I saw it in our Staples ad for 19.99. I previously purchased this same one at Staples 10 years ago for 19.99 and it just quit working. I assumed it was now more expensive. The 3 stars are for the price difference!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Kay

customer_reviews.title: SUCKS
customer_reviews.text: TERRIBLE!!! Machine is VERY slow both sending and receiving. After sending/receiving about 50 pages, machine would not move beyond "sending" even though we heard receiving 'sound' that recipient Fax was recognized and wanted to receive my Fax. My machine kept giving error report message "poor line condition" including using a different telephone line with no splitter/filters. I went through all trouble shooting in manual and on Brother Website. SUCKS
customer_reviews.author: did

customer_reviews.title: Cost Affordable Essential!
customer_reviews.text: Such a handy office appliance! Especially since many doctor's office, schools, and other still require faxed documents as opposed to email for security reasons. A cost affordable essential to have in your home.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect machine for what I need.
customer_reviews.text: This is a simple design fax without all the bells and whistles. It uses a carbon paper type cartridge, so you don't have to worry about ink cartridges drying out and going to waste. I have to have a fax for my home office. I mostly send faces and rarely receive them, but when I do, I don't need to worry about the ink cartridges being dry. And you would be surprised at the bells and whistles that Brothers did build in.
customer_reviews.author: A. Langa

customer_reviews.title: Fine product for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Fine product for the price. Faxes and copies; perfect for very low-volume needs. The reviewers complaining about "cheap plastic" need to spend hundreds more to get what they want. Sturdy enough for $35.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Review

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: it works very good for the price, too bad i dont have phone line anymore so i can't use it but everytime i need to fax something i have to go to the store ...
customer_reviews.author: alfredo vergara

customer_reviews.title: FAX machine
customer_reviews.text: Very good inexpensive FAX machine. I don't fax that often but on occasion when there is a need to do so then then machine completes the task. Very simple to set up and use. The only drawback is when I receive a fax the person sending the fax have to tell me that he/she is sending it so that I can set the machine to receive it. I don't fax enough to have a separate fax line so this is no problem. Very pleased with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Walter H

customer_reviews.title: Works beautifully with my Ooma phone setup, and is so cute! Sends and receives no problem
customer_reviews.text: This little Gem! Where have you been? I have an Ooma phone set up at home (kinda like a magic jack) So i was super concerned i wasn't going to be able to set this up. With the "LINE" cord going from the fax to to the Ooma and the "EXT" cord going from the fax to the houses main phone port, i was able to keep the fax machine on FAX/TEL mode. and had no problem sending and receiving clear faxes without interfering with my phone service. I was very surprised. And did i mention how cute and little it is? For 30$ i couldn't go wrong. Good for light use :)
customer_reviews.author: Flea

customer_reviews.title: Back to simple.
customer_reviews.text: Just wanted a simple fax machine....this fits the bill. Plug it in when I use it and unplug when I am finished. No beeps in the middle of the night and no paper wasted on fax spam.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbi Neyland

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up
customer_reviews.text: Just got this machine and it works awesome.easy to set up,took me all of 5 minutes tops.Sent the registration in threw the fax to Brother.Got a return fax right away.So I knew it was hooked up the right way.This is for home and for someone that won`t be faxing a ton of material.Its perfect for what I wanted.Its also small and doesn`t take up a big foot print.All in all very very pleased with my purchase .You can`t go wrong for this price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simple Budget-Wise Fax Machine
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for a simple fax machine then the Brother FAX-575 fits that description. It is a compact fax machine for home office. I have this fax machine since 2005 and bought a 2nd one in 2006 for a housewarming gift. I needed a small compact fax machine for my home office to receive/send fax on those here-and-there occasions.
customer_reviews.author: Bargain_Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Easy and economical.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy, it does what we need. The carbon paper doesn't give the best quality, but we mainly use it for outgoing faxes. It is smaller and lighter than our last fax and very simple to use. For convenience in a small home office, this is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey C

customer_reviews.title: Never worked. We were using this as an extra ...
customer_reviews.text: Never worked. We were using this as an extra fax machine, but it did not work. We waited to have a tech savy friend try it, but they could not make it work. Is it too late to return??
customer_reviews.author: Rosenfeld Family

customer_reviews.title: It was apparently a good value for the price
customer_reviews.text: This machine has now been in use in our public library for three or four years, and it still works. Of course, it's a small library and not many people fax nowadays, so it only needs to function occasionally. It was apparently a good value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Robert H. Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Impressed with this machine
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to have at home after my expensive all in one dell machine had problems. This little machine makes copies (rather slow) but they are pretty good. The fax works perfectly. The handset is super tiny, but I don't use it to make calls anyway. You have to keep paper in it, so you won't miss a fax. It only holds about 20 sheets, so you have to watch it. It is definitely worth the money. I don't recommend it for use by more than one person or in a large company office environment. It is not fast enough to handle that workload.
customer_reviews.author: JGreer

customer_reviews.title: The price was great. This is not a plug in and use ...
customer_reviews.text: The price was great. This is not a plug in and use fax machine but, that is to be expected for the price. It takes a little time to set up but the instructions are easy to follow.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Irick

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Simple fax machine, works great for the occasional faxes, and is small enough to not add too much clutter to your desk area. Pretty good fax for the money and I have no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Ortiz

customer_reviews.title: cheap expendable fax machine
customer_reviews.text: Price is good, but this is the 3rd we have gotten. Replace about every year. Bought the Square Trade Plan so replacements cost about $4, but it is a little hassle.
customer_reviews.author: craig bigler

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this product!
customer_reviews.text: I still can't use it as a fax! Just using it as a phone as its really not worth the time to send it back. My fault for buying the 'cheaper' one. When you pick up (or use speaker option) and then put in the number you are trying to fax, you normally should be able to push start when you hear tone, OH NO not with this one, you push start fax button FIRST then put in the number you are calling, very strange, maybe mine is unique and screwed up only one. Good luck, but buy a better one. don't waste you money on this. its a joke.
customer_reviews.author: Shona Davis

customer_reviews.title: Important when needed.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a Brother fax to replace the Brother that went bad. Price was a great factor in the purchase because I don't use it often but I like to have one when needed.
customer_reviews.author: abc

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Junk
customer_reviews.text: I returned it. This thing is absolutely junk. It's extremely difficult to program, and even after I figured it out, I couldn't get it to work. I spent well over an hour on the phone with the factory tech support people, and no matter what we tried, it wouldn't send a fax. And as if that isn't enough, the construction is extremely flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Reinventor

customer_reviews.title: Best suited for the occasional Fax
customer_reviews.text: Having used a similar Brother fax machine, I knew what to expect. This machine is the epitome of you get what you pay for. I only have to fax a few times a year so this machine is more than adequate, but if you plan on doing more than that, I would suggest moving on up the price scale. This machine is very slow and it's operation is crude by most office standards. If you just need a machine for the home for the occasional fax to your insurance provider,tax prep, broker, etc this will be just fine, but asking more of it than that is going to leave you frustrated.
customer_reviews.author: ThePlateau

customer_reviews.title: no modification print your stencils
customer_reviews.text: I use this to make tattoo stencils on carbon paper and it does a fair job for so cheap I don't understand why the tattoo ones are so expensive no modifying necessary it is also insanely durable my 3 year old drug it around the house by the phone for a couple months before I started using it... Worst that happened is the cord came unplugged if I ever need another one for any reason this would be it.
customer_reviews.author: Robbie

customer_reviews.title: home fax
customer_reviews.text: Save on gas and charges. I paid $50 for this machine with an extra cartridge which divides to 27.7 cents per page for the first 180 pages sent, and .11 cents per page thereafter. I had it hooked up and faxing in 5 minutes. Feels solid for the money, it's small, works great, has many features I'll never use but remains super simple to hook up and operate. With the price of gas as it is Brother and Amazon will sell a ton of these. I highly recommend this fine little Home fax machine. It has paid for itself and the extra $20 cartridge already, never mind the convenience it is providing.
customer_reviews.author: J. King

customer_reviews.title: Great Fax for home VoIP system!
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed for my VoIP system MagicJack. If you have problems using it over a VOIP, be sure to check the Brother site & this link:  They give great instructions on how to set up your fax. I always have my fax connected to the MagicJack without any problem. I just temporarily unplug my computer's network cable (CAT5) from the DSL router before sending a fax. It sends successfully every time.
customer_reviews.author: NikNew

customer_reviews.title: Seems fine so far
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. I've only faxed out on it - very easy but not received any incoming so can't speak to that function. I had an older HP fax machine for years, a real work horse so this one feels flimsy in comparison but I like its compact size. The ink replacements -or rolls- I'm not sure which it takes yet are cheap, especially compared to HP ink and that was a factor in my decision to buy this machine. I do use a fax fairly regularly in my business so am hoping it can hold up to my busy season.
customer_reviews.author: Meherc

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: A must have. Very easy to set up. Good for any household.
customer_reviews.author: Jondauber

customer_reviews.title: Great plain-paper fax and copy functions
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an old and no longer fully functional Panasonic coated-paper fax machine, which no longer had a working display and produced images that faded rather quickly. The Brother Fax-575 is a refreshing upgrade -- intuitively easy to assemble and to use, and producing crisp images of received faxes and copied documents and pictures that vies in quality with a professional scanner. Of course, a scanner can be used to save images to a computer; but if all you want is a paper copy of a document, the Brother Fax-575 is an excellent choice.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Wells Glueck

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Works well, more complicated than the old one but easy enough to set up if you just want to send & receive. It's a bit slow in printing, but for our 10 to 30 faxes/mo. it is a good bargain & was a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Little Guy!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this phone/fax machine for perusal use at home. I had a good offer for phone/TV/Internet service bundled package. Since I us a cellphone for my phone calls, I chose to use the phone line as a home phone/fax number. I ordered the fax only yesterday after I got home from work and it was delivered today by the time I got home from work! (I am an Amazon prime member). Setting it up was a breeze and both the phone and fax work well. The copier is an added bonus! I will update review if any issues arise in the future!
customer_reviews.author: Prince

customer_reviews.title: Efficient machine.
customer_reviews.text: An efficient, compact fax machine without problems. Being a plain paper machine it doubles as a copier. The set up was painless and very easy to get it rolling. All in all a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Brother FAX-575 Personal FAX, Phone and Copier
customer_reviews.text: Brother FAX-575 Personal FAX, Phone and Copier. Tested the product and all worked fine( Fax send/receive and copy). You can use the Redial/Pause button to store a 3 seconds pause in your speed dial ( to reveal your own caller ID ):- good feature; as some fax machines do not answer phone with caller ID blocked. I don't use it much so I don't know how many copies can I receive before the ink carbon roll is used up. It's fine for someone who send faxes and do not receive too many faxes. It served my purpose.
customer_reviews.author: R. Shen

customer_reviews.title: Good fax for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is a good little fax for the person that is primarily interested in a fax machine that does limited functions.- that is what I wanted. It works well and prints out clear copies. If you want a machine that will hold a lot of paper and process more than a few copies at a time, this is probably not going to be a machine that you'd like. But if you want a "plain Jane" kind of machine that will handle sending up to a dozen or so copies at time, this machine will work for you. And you can't beat the price. .
customer_reviews.author: David L. Martin

customer_reviews.title: THIS PRODUCT BROKE IN LESS THAN 30 DAYS!
customer_reviews.text: I used this product for less than 30 days and the gears broke. Brother wants to repair the item and expects me to go without a fax machine while they are repairing the item! My business requires a fax machine every day. I cannot go without it for one day. I had to buy a new one. I do not want to own two of them! If you sell me crap, you should be prepared to give me my money back!
customer_reviews.author: d&c

customer_reviews.title: Great little machine
customer_reviews.text: My mom had been wanting a new fax machine for the past 2 months but everysingle one we looked at was just too big, bulky, or too complicated. When I saw this one she loved it. Not too many buttons, nothing extra, just the basic functions a fax machine should have. Putting it together was pretty easy too. The phone is about he size of your hand, which I don't mind because we hardly use it, but it's something that you might keep in mind if you do use the phone and the size of it matters to you. Overall it's been working quite well. Very happy I purchased this.
customer_reviews.author: Marisol M.

customer_reviews.title: I already have a Brother FAX 575 Personal Fax and ...
customer_reviews.text: I already have a Brother FAX 575 Personal Fax and absolute had no trouble with it for my business until the receivers of my faxes started getting black lines down the page which meant that I have to clean the heads of the fax. I really don't have time or the patience to do that because I am too busy so I decided to just get another one in its place. I have no complaints about this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for home use and the occasional user.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very basic fax for personal use. It is quick and dependable and has a very low learning curve. It's the perfect fax for someone like me who only needs a fax about once a week to send or receive documents, medical referrals and so on. It also takes up little space. In an office setting where use is more intensive I would get something more professional.
customer_reviews.author: tachi1Top Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Gets the Job Done
customer_reviews.text: This is not a big ol'e fancy fax machine. It's a small fax that simply gets the job done. It doesn't feel like something that can withstand years and years of high volume traffic in an office. But if you're looking for a small fax to keep in your home office this seems great. I keep mine in the closet and only take it out on the counter when actually using it. And I have seen some people asking and I use Uverse for my home phone and don't use a "traditional phone line" and this works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Just Some Dude Who Buys Stuff on Amazon. A lot.

customer_reviews.title: If you need it for work purposes daily it might be better to just go into an office
customer_reviews.text: Works about 60% of the time. Jams often with one page going through. Tries to print out reports even though I have disabled that feature. If you need it for work purposes daily it might be better to just go into an office.
customer_reviews.author: Savannah

customer_reviews.title: old stock procead with caution
customer_reviews.text: my second one ,wish the first one lasted longer than ten years.but for the $ it is a throughaway . dont use it very often now,but had to replace the other one.caution mine was old stock so it most likely wont last as long as plastic ages and results in failure
customer_reviews.author: bill

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup
customer_reviews.text: Received this product quickly and setup was also extremely quick and easy. Don't even need to use the manual for setup. We got this because the local FAX place wants $2.00/page to either send or receive a FAX. This little bugger will pay for itself quickly at that rate. The cord for the phone part is a little short so I recommend getting a longer cord. And, since the included ribbon cartridge will only print about 30 FAX pages, ordering the replacement regular length ribbon cartridge at the same time is recommended. Amazon also had the best price for this FAX machine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Functional - Easy to Use and Priced Well
customer_reviews.text: So far - so good. My sister-in-law is hearing impaired, so we communicate by fax. I needed something that did not have a lot of bells and whistles (which is hard to find these days) - everyone seems to feel that every piece of equipment needs to do everything - but sometimes - simple IS better. She has a learning disability so making sure that it was easy to use; easy to replace the cartridge etc. was a must. Can't beat the cost either!
customer_reviews.author: KatM

customer_reviews.title: Hate this thing!  Spend a few more bucks for far less hassle!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a flimsy, slow, hard to work with, piece of junk,...and you will be buying ribbon for it shortly....(better yet, buy some NOW)....it can make a copy or two; it can even receive a page or two (when you have not run out of ribbon without warning..aaaahhh); but, when it comes to sending more than a page, it feeds poorly, and I have never been able to trust what it has transmitted. The built in cover sheet function is worthless. Save yourself time and money and learn from my mistake! Buy something else!!!
customer_reviews.author: H.C.

customer_reviews.title: Works 50/50
customer_reviews.text: This machine is compact which is nice but it only works about 50% issuing a "poor line condition" report which is false as our lines are fine. We've had this product in our office for only 2 months. We would not recommend this product or EDoves as the company it comes from. We are not having success on resolving our issue. Warranties are usually much longer than that.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Alfred Kerr

customer_reviews.title: Fax Is There When You Need It
customer_reviews.text: The most important thing for me is that it listens in on the phone line, and will take control if it hears fax tones. Otherwise it stays out of the way. And of course it works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: John Carlton

customer_reviews.title: Good product and well priced.
customer_reviews.text: Even though so much is done on the internet, there are occasions where you need to FAX information to companies and people. This machine does it well. It is small and takes up very little office space.
customer_reviews.author: C. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: Printer fits perfectly into classroom setting. Great backup device for other busy printers on the system.
customer_reviews.author: David Nikolaus

customer_reviews.title: P.S.  I forgot to mention on my last review..that when someone sends you a fax, it takes about 2-3 minutes to receive one.
customer_reviews.text: I love this machine..but the only reason I gave it 3 stars is because you can only fax one thing at a time..I have tried to fax more than 2 papers at a time and both papers come out..That is a big problem..The printer works great! I have a home office so I just have to enter the fax number 3 or 4 times if I want to fax multiple papers..Otherwise its very small, which is fine for me..
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda Sheck

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this fax machine. I needed it for some work I was doing and it is very easy to use and good price.
customer_reviews.author: Robd

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and fairly reliable
customer_reviews.text: One of the few basic fax units that can accommodate a separate answering device so I can use one land line for occasional vocal calls and a few incoming faxes a week. Bought this as a back-up for original that's a few years old. Uses film rather than toner or ink. It's also equipped with a battery back up so I don't have to re-set everything if the power goes off for a few seconds like old HP that this replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Lovin' the River

product_meta.title: Brother FAX-575 Personal Fax, Phone, and Copier
product_meta.description:
BROTHER FAX575 PLAIN - PAPER FAX/COPIER/PHONE. BROTHER FAX575 PLAIN - PAPER FAX/COPIER/PHONE -

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
A convenient communications tool for a range of personal and home office applications, the new Fax 575 is a compact, stylish plain-paper fax with an unobtrusive footprint that works well in typical home or home office environments. Special attention to compatibility with home telephone usage lets it switch seamlessly between fax and telephone modes, allowing customers to receive fax and voice calls on a single line. 

 Features: 

 * Up to 10-Page Auto Document Feeder 
 * 50-Sheet Input Paper Capacity 
 * 512KB Memory stores up to 25 pages for Out-of-Paper Reception 
 * 104-Station Auto Dialing 
 * Convenience Copying with Sort 

What's in the Box
Fax unit, telephone handset, handset cord, power cord, phone cord, 30-page starter print cartridge, user's guide, warranty and registration card
feature_bullets: Black-and-white copying with up to 400 x 400 dpi resolution
9,600 BPS fax modem transmits at about 15 seconds per page
512 KB memory stores up to 25 pages

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars1,907 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
